Unnamed: 2: An assessment which takes place in person, at the physical location under investigation
A survey of a heritage place or feature from an aerial perspective, for example, by airplane, drone (UAV), or kite
An in-person and on-location survey which records information about the features, interpretation, and other details about an archaeological or heritage place
An in-person survey which records information specifically about standing structures
An in-person and on-location survey which records information about the condition and potential threats to a heritage place
An in-person and on-location assessment of damage which has occurred to a heritage place as the result of an emergency situation, such as a natural disaster or conflict situation

ملخص التقييم: مسح عن طريق الغطس (تحت سطح الماء)

Unnamed: 2: An in-person and on-location assessment of risk factors that may affect the heritage place or feature. This is a more detailed assessment than is undertaken during a normal Condition Assessment.
An in-person and on-location, usually rapid, recording of an archaeological site or feature which is in imminent danger of damage or destruction, e.g. during or in advance of construction projects.
MK Comments: No, I would say: التوثيق السريع الإنقاذي

Unnamed: 2: An assessment which takes place from a remote location using images, descriptions, or other representations of the location under investigation
MK Comments: No, I would say:تقييم من المكتب (من خلال الكومبيوتر)

ملخص التقييم: تقييم طارىء لتأثير ما حدث للموقع (تفسير الصور)
Unnamed: 2: A remote assessment of damage which has occurred to a heritage place as the result of an emergency situation, such as a natural disaster or conflict situation, using satellite imagery or photographs
Ahmed Buzaian suggested translation: تقييم طارىء لتأثير ما حدث للموقع (تفسير الصور)

Unnamed: 2: A remote assessment which records information about the features, interpretation, and other details about an archaeological or heritage place using satellite imagery or photographs
An remote assessment which records information about the condition and potential threats to a heritage place using satellite imagery or photographs

An remote assessment of risk factors that may affect the heritage place or feature using satellite imagery or photographs. This is a more detailed assessment than is undertaken during a normal Condition Assessment.
Entering data taken directly from a written source, e.g. a published survey, the details of which it may or may not be possible to confirm using remote sensing
Simple cleaning activities, e.g. formatting names, making sure there are no typos etc. Also includes reviewing (and if necessary) enhancing records of trainees or students.
